randomly sample documents or features from a dfm

Sample randomly from a dfm object, from documents or features.

dfm_sample(x, size = ndoc(x), replace = FALSE, prob = NULL,
  what = c("documents", "features"))

Arguments

x
the dfm object whose documents or features will be sampled
size
a positive number, the number of documents or features to select
replace
logical; should sampling be with replacement?
prob
a vector of probability weights for obtaining the elements of the vector being sampled.
what
dimension (of a dfm) to sample: can be documents or features

Value

A dfm object with number of documents or features equal to size, drawn from the dfm x.

See also

sample

Examples

myDfm <- dfm(data_char_inaugural[1:10], verbose = FALSE)
dfm_sample(myDfm)[, 1:10]
#> Document-feature matrix of: 10 documents, 10 features (31% sparse).
#> 10 x 10 sparse Matrix of class "dfmSparse"
#>                  features
#> docs              fellow  - citizens  of the senate and house representatives :
#>   1821-Monroe         10  6       15 197 360      0 141     0               0 0
#>   1813-Madison         1  1        4  65 100      0  44     0               0 0
#>   1805-Jefferson       8  2       10 101 143      0  93     0               0 0
#>   1797-Adams           3  5        5 140 163      1 130     0               2 0
#>   1809-Madison         1  6        1  69 104      0  43     0               0 0
#>   1793-Washington      1  0        1  11  13      0   2     0               0 1
#>   1789-Washington      3  3        5  71 116      1  48     2               2 1
#>   1825-Adams           3 11        2 245 304      0 116     0               1 0
#>   1801-Jefferson       7 12        7 104 130      0  81     0               0 1
#>   1817-Monroe          6 14        9 164 275      0 122     0               1 0
dfm_sample(myDfm, replace = TRUE)[, 1:10]
#> Document-feature matrix of: 10 documents, 10 features (32% sparse).
#> 10 x 10 sparse Matrix of class "dfmSparse"
#>                  features
#> docs              fellow - citizens  of the senate and house representatives :
#>   1809-Madison         1 6        1  69 104      0  43     0               0 0
#>   1805-Jefferson       8 2       10 101 143      0  93     0               0 0
#>   1793-Washington      1 0        1  11  13      0   2     0               0 1
#>   1789-Washington      3 3        5  71 116      1  48     2               2 1
#>   1813-Madison         1 1        4  65 100      0  44     0               0 0
#>   1793-Washington      1 0        1  11  13      0   2     0               0 1
#>   1821-Monroe         10 6       15 197 360      0 141     0               0 0
#>   1789-Washington      3 3        5  71 116      1  48     2               2 1
#>   1809-Madison         1 6        1  69 104      0  43     0               0 0
#>   1809-Madison         1 6        1  69 104      0  43     0               0 0
dfm_sample(myDfm, what = "features")[1:10, ]
#> Document-feature matrix of: 10 documents, 10 features (87% sparse).
#> 10 x 10 sparse Matrix of class "dfmSparse"
#>                  features
#> docs              formation propagating markets luxuries bearing discontinue
#>   1789-Washington         0           0       0        0       0           0
#>   1793-Washington         0           0       0        0       0           0
#>   1797-Adams              1           1       0        0       0           0
#>   1801-Jefferson          0           0       0        0       0           0
#>   1805-Jefferson          0           0       0        1       0           1
#>   1809-Madison            0           0       0        0       0           0
#>   1813-Madison            0           0       0        0       0           0
#>   1817-Monroe             0           0       1        0       0           0
#>   1821-Monroe             0           0       0        0       3           0
#>   1825-Adams              3           0       0        0       0           0
#>                  features
#> docs              calamity maimed continue deserved
#>   1789-Washington        0      0        0        0
#>   1793-Washington        0      0        0        0
#>   1797-Adams             1      0        1        0
#>   1801-Jefferson         0      0        0        0
#>   1805-Jefferson         0      0        0        0
#>   1809-Madison           0      0        0        0
#>   1813-Madison           0      1        0        0
#>   1817-Monroe            0      0        1        0
#>   1821-Monroe            0      0        2        0
#>   1825-Adams             0      0        0        1
